OUTWITTING.Definition: getting an advantage over the others by acting more cleverly

OUTSMARTING.Definition: getting an advantage over the others by acting more cleverly

INGENUITY.Definition: the quality of being clever and original

PERSUADING.Definition: making it do it by talking

FINE.Definition: require a payment from them as a penalty

POISONOUS.Definition: producing poison (a substance able to kill if taken into the body)

SLITHERING.Definition: moving easily with a twisting or curving motion

REWARD.Definition: money given in exchange for a good service or work

ENTERPRISING.Definition: good at thinking of things that would make money

BREEDING.Definition: causing them to reproduce or have children

REWARDS.Definition: money given in exchange for a good service or work

TAILS.Definition: the extended rear parts of the animals

INCENTIVE.Definition: reason or motive for them to do it

TAIL.Definition: the extended rear part of the animals

TURNS OUT.Definition: happens or is proved to be the case

CROPS.Definition: plants grown by people in large amounts

EVIDENCE.Definition: a reason for believing it had actually happened

OFFSET.Definition: balance (the amount of the non-recycled materials)

POLLUTER.Definition: one who pollutes or causes harm to the environment

DUMP.Definition: a location for depositing or putting rubbish

POPPY.Definition: a flower from which opium is collected

CROP.Definition: a plan grown in large amounts

POPPIES.Definition: the flowers from which opium is collected

NOTORIOUS.Definition: very well known for something bad

OVER-RELIANCE.Definition: a situation in which they are too much dependant

VICIOUS CYCLE.Definition: a continuing bad situation in which one problem causes another problem that makes the first problem worse

INNOVATIVE.Definition: using or showing new methods or ideas

ENCOURAGING.Definition: making them more likely to do it

EXHAUST FUMES.Definition: waste gases produced by an engine

RODENTS.Definition: small mammals with large front teeth, such as mice, rats and squirrels

INFESTATION.Definition: the presence of an unusually large number of insects

MASS.Definition: having an effect on a large number of people

FAMINE.Definition: a situation in which there was not enough food

HINDSIGHT.Definition: the ability to understand it after it has happened

TRY AS YOU MIGHT.Definition: no matter how hard you try

BEAT IT.Definition: use it to their own advantage, be more clever than it
